ezc_po_acknowledgement: Business Rule: Stores Purchase Order (PO) acknowledgements created in the portal and represents the starting point of the inbound procurement process.
Business Rule: 'ezpa_doc_no' is the Purchase Order number and is the primary identifier used to relate POs with ASNs, GRNs, and invoices.
Business Rule: One Purchase Order can be associated with multiple ASN records in 'ezc_shipment_header' through 'ezsh_po_num'.
Business Rule: Organizational context for a PO is defined using 'ezpa_comp_code', 'ezpa_pur_org', 'ezpa_plant', and 'ezpa_group'.
Business Rule: 'ezpa_created_by' stores a system user ID and must be resolved using 'ezc_users.eu_id' to obtain the creatorâ€™s name.
Business Rule: 'ezpa_doc_status' and 'ezpa_sap_status' indicate the lifecycle and SAP synchronization state of the Purchase Order.
Business Rule: CRITICAL: 'ezpa_created_by' is specifically for the PO Creator. Do not use this if the user asks for the ASN Creator.
Business Rule: WARNING: Value columns in this table (like total value) are often 0.00. Do not use them for financial reporting.

Business Rule: CRITICAL JOIN RULE: 'ezpa_dir_asn' is frequently NULL. NEVER use it to join ASNs. You MUST join from ASN to PO using 'ezc_shipment_header.ezsh_po_num = ezc_po_acknowledgement.ezpa_doc_no'.
ezc_shipment_header: Business Rule: Represents ASN (Advance Shipment Notice) at header level; each row corresponds to a shipment created against a Purchase Order.
Business Rule: 'ezsh_sh_id' uniquely identifies an ASN and is the primary shipment reference across the process.
Business Rule: 'ezsh_po_num' links the ASN back to the originating Purchase Order in 'ezc_po_acknowledgement'.
Business Rule: If 'ezsh_ibd_no' is empty, the ASN is considered not converted into an IBD.
Business Rule: 'ezsh_ibd_date' represents the date on which the ASN was converted to an IBD in SAP.
Business Rule: 'ezsh_created_on' is the authoritative timestamp for ASN creation and is used for time-based reporting.
Business Rule: 'ezsh_status' represents ASN lifecycle state; records with status 'A' are excluded from operational reports.
Business Rule: 'ezsh_sold_to' stores the vendor code and may contain leading zeros; comparisons require trimming leading zeros.
Business Rule: 'ezsh_gr_status', 'ezsh_gr_number', and 'ezsh_gr_date' reflect Goods Receipt status at ASN header level.
Business Rule: 'ezsh_created_by' stores a system user ID and must be resolved using 'ezc_users' to obtain creator details.
Business Rule: CRITICAL: 'ezsh_created_by' is specifically for the ASN Creator.
Business Rule: CRITICAL: For Goods Receipt (GRN) searches, do NOT rely on 'ezsh_gr_number' here. You MUST JOIN 'ezc_erp_mat_doc_items' via 'ship_id' to find the actual GRN.
Business Rule: To get the Vendor Name, use 'ezsh_sold_to' (Vendor Code) and JOIN 'ezc_customer' or 'ezc_user_def_key_values'.
ezc_shipment_lines: Business Rule: Stores material-level details for each ASN.
Business Rule: Shipment lines are associated with an ASN using 'ezsl_sh_id'.
Business Rule: Each ASN can have multiple shipment line records.
Business Rule: 'ezsl_qty_shipped' represents the quantity dispatched for a material.
Business Rule: 'ezsl_qty_received' represents the quantity received and is populated after Goods Receipt.
Business Rule: Line-level Goods Receipt completion is tracked using 'ezsl_gr_status', 'ezsl_gr_number', and 'ezsl_gr_date'.
Business Rule: Shipment line records inherit Purchase Order context through 'ezsl_po_num'.
ezc_erp_mat_doc_header: Business Rule: Represents SAP Material Document headers created during Goods Receipt posting.
Business Rule: 'mat_doc' is the SAP Goods Receipt Number (GRN) and uniquely identifies a material document.
Business Rule: Document-level dates such as 'doc_date' and 'pstng_date' represent SAP posting metadata.
Business Rule: 'username' stores the system user ID who posted the GRN and must be resolved using 'ezc_users'.
ezc_erp_mat_doc_items: Business Rule: Represents SAP Material Document line items and is the authoritative source for Goods Receipt data.
Business Rule: Presence of records in this table indicates that Goods Receipt has been completed.
Business Rule: 'mat_doc' links line items to the material document header.
Business Rule: 'po_number' links Goods Receipt line items back to the originating Purchase Order.
Business Rule: 'ship_id' provides linkage between Goods Receipt records and the ASN / IBD reference.
Business Rule: If an ASN has an IBD number but no corresponding entry in this table, it is considered Pending for GR.
Business Rule: Monetary values received are derived using 'amount_lc' and quantity using 'entry_qnt'.
ezc_grn_inv_docs: Business Rule: Stores invoice documents uploaded or processed against Goods Receipts.
Business Rule: 'egid_grn_no' links an invoice to a specific Goods Receipt Number.
Business Rule: 'egid_po_no' links the invoice back to the originating Purchase Order.
Business Rule: 'egid_ibd_no' associates the invoice with a specific Inbound Delivery.
Business Rule: 'egid_inv_amount' represents the invoice amount processed through OCR or upload.
Business Rule: 'egid_copied_by' stores the system user ID of the user who processed the invoice and must be resolved using 'ezc_users'.
Business Rule: Invoice processing status is tracked using 'egid_status'.
ezc_user_def_key_values: Business Rule: Acts as a centralized configuration and authorization mapping table that links users, vendors, materials, plants, and procurement attributes to specific business classifications and access rules.

Business Rule: 'eudkv_key' defines the configuration or business dimension. Supported keys include 'PUR_GRP' (Purchase Group), 'PUR_ORG' (Purchase Organization), 'MAT_GROUP' (Material Group), 'BID_CAT' (Bidding Category), 'SAP_ID' (ERP User Identifier), 'PLANT' (Plant Code), 'DEFROLE' (Default Application Role), and 'MAT_TYPE' (Material Type).

Business Rule: 'eudkv_value' stores the allowed or assigned value for the given key, such as specific purchase org codes, plant codes, material types (e.g., '2P', 'PM'), role identifiers, or ERP/SAP user mappings.

Business Rule: 'eudkv_user_id' represents the business subject the rule applies to, typically a system user ID, vendor code, broker code, or customer/Sold-To/Ship-To identifier, depending on the key context.

Business Rule: Access control, filtering, and personalization across transactional modules (POs, shipments, workflows, bidding, and ERP integrations) are enforced by matching normalized business identifiers (e.g., trimmed leading zeros on partner/vendor/customer codes) from operational tables against 'eudkv_user_id'.

Business Rule: Multiple rows per 'eudkv_user_id' are allowed to support multi-dimensional authorization (e.g., a single user, vendor, or broker can be linked to multiple plants, purchase orgs, material groups, roles, and material types).
Business Rule: This table serves as the primary driver for role-based data visibility, workflow routing, ERP user mapping, and dynamic business rule evaluation throughout the application.
ezc_users: Business Rule: Central user master table used to resolve system user IDs into human-readable user details and user classifications across the platform.
Business Rule: 'eu_id' is the unique system user identifier referenced by all transactional, workflow, and audit tables.
Business Rule: 'eu_first_name' and 'eu_last_name' together form the display name of the user for UI, reports, logs, and chatbot responses.

Business Rule: 'eu_type' defines the business role of the user. Supported values include '2' = Internal User, '3' = Vendor, and '4' = Broker. This classification drives role-based access control, data visibility, and workflow routing.
Business Rule: Columns such as 'ezsh_created_by', 'ezpa_created_by', 'egid_copied_by', and 'username' store 'eu_id' values that must be resolved through this table to identify the acting user.
Business Rule: User resolution is mandatory for chatbot responses, audit trails, compliance reports, and workflow history views involving document creators, modifiers, approvers, or processors.

Business Rule: Filtering and authorization logic may combine 'eu_type' with mappings from 'ezc_user_def_key_values' to enforce vendor-, broker-, and internal-user-specific business rules and data visibility constraints.
ezc_customer: Business Rule: Stores customer or business partner master records.
Business Rule: 'ec_no' uniquely identifies a business partner in the portal.
Business Rule: 'ec_erp_cust_no' maps the portal business partner to the SAP customer number.
Business Rule: Customer master data is used for reference and enrichment, not for transactional flow control.
ezc_customer_addr: Business Rule: Stores address and contact information for customers and business partners.
Business Rule: Address records are associated with customer master records using 'eca_reference_no'.
Business Rule: This table is used only for display and communication purposes and does not affect document lifecycle logic.
